Sorrow turned to joy 47. "I have overcome the world" 48. High priestly prayer 49. Crossing the Kidron 50. Garden of Gethsemane 51. "Sit here while I pray" 52. Peter, James, John taken further 53. "My soul is very sorrowful, even to death" 54. First prayer 55. Disciples sleeping 56. Second prayer 57. Disciples sleeping again 58. Third prayer 59. Angel strengthens 60. "The hour has come" 61. Judas arrives with crowd 62. The kiss 63. "Friend, do what you came to do" 64. Arrest 65. Peter's sword, Malchus's ear 66. "Put your sword away" 67. "Have you come out as against a robber?" 68. Disciples flee 69. Young man flees naked PART TWENTY-TWO: REVELATION 1. Prologue: revelation of Jesus Christ 2. John on Patmos 3. Voice like trumpet 4. Vision of the Son of Man 5. "Fear not, I am the first and the last" 6. Letter to Ephesus 7. Letter to Smyrna 8. Letter to Pergamum 9. Letter to Thyatira 10. Letter to Sardis 11. Letter to Philadelphia 12. Letter to Laodicea 13. Door open in heaven 14. Throne room 15. Scroll with seven seals 16. "Who is worthy?" 17. Weeping because no one worthy 18. The Lamb 19. Lamb takes scroll 20. New song: "Worthy are you" 21. Every creature worshiping 22. First seal: white horse, conqueror 23. Second seal: red horse, war 24. Third seal: black horse, famine 25. Fourth seal: pale horse, death 26. Fifth seal: souls under altar 27. Sixth seal: earthquake, sun black, moon blood, stars falling 28. Sealing of 144,000 29. Great multitude in white robes 30. Seventh seal: silence in heaven 31. Seven trumpets given 32. First trumpet: hail and fire 33. Second trumpet: mountain burning thrown into sea 34. Third trumpet: star Wormwood 35. Fourth trumpet: sun, moon, stars struck 36. Fifth trumpet: locusts from abyss 37. Sixth trumpet: four angels released, cavalry of 200 million 38. Angel with little scroll 39. John eats scroll 40. Two witnesses 41. Witnesses killed 42. Witnesses raised 43. Seventh trumpet: "The kingdom of the world has become the kingdom of our Lord" 44. Woman clothed with sun 45. Dragon waiting to devour 46. Child caught up to God 47. War in heaven 48. Dragon cast down 49. Dragon pursues woman 50. Beast from sea 51. "Who is like the beast?" 52. Beast from earth 53. 666 54. Lamb on Mount Zion with 144,000 55. Three angels' messages 56. "Fallen, fallen is Babylon" 57. Harvest of earth 58. Winepress of God's wrath 59. Seven bowls of wrath 60. First bowl: sores 61. Second bowl: sea becomes blood 62. Third bowl: rivers become blood 63. Fourth bowl: sun scorches 64. Fifth bowl: darkness 65. Sixth bowl: Euphrates dried 66. Spirits like frogs 67. Armageddon 68. Seventh bowl: "It is done" 69. Babylon the great 70. "Come out of her, my people" 71. Fall of Babylon 72. Heaven rejoices 73. "Hallelujah!" 74. Marriage supper of the Lamb 75. Rider on white horse 76. Beast and kings gathered 77. Beast and false prophet thrown into lake of fire 78. Satan bound 79. Thousand years 80. Thrones and judgment 81. First resurrection 82. Satan released 83. Final rebellion 84. Fire from heaven 85. Satan thrown into lake of fire 86. Great white throne 87. Dead judged 88. Death and Hades thrown into lake of fire 89. New heaven and new earth 90. New Jerusalem descending 91. "He will wipe away every tear" 92. "Death shall be no more" 93. "Behold, I am making all things new" 94. "It is done" 95. The city described 96. River of life 97. Tree of life 98. No more curse 99. They shall see His face 100. No more night 101. "I am coming soon" 102. "Come, Lord Jesus" PART TWENTY-THREE: THE CHURCH THAT WILL BE 1. Pentecost 2. Peter's sermon 3. Three thousand added 4. Life of early community 5. Lame man at Beautiful Gate 6. Peter's second sermon 7. Peter and John arrested 8. Peter before Sanhedrin 9. Believers pray 10. Place shaken 11. Barnabas sells field 12. Ananias and Sapphira 13. Signs and wonders 14. Apostles imprisoned 15. Angel opens prison 16. Apostles before Sanhedrin again 17. Gamaliel's counsel 18. Apostles beaten 19. Seven chosen 20. Stephen's ministry 21. Stephen accused 22. Stephen's speech 23. Stephen's vision 24. Stephen stoned 25. Saul holding coats 26. Persecution scatters church 27. Philip in Samaria 28. Simon the magician 29. Peter and John in Samaria 30. Simon rebuked 31. Philip and the Ethiopian 32. Philip transported to Azotus 33. Saul's persecution intensifies 34. Saul's journey to Damascus 35. Light from heaven 36. "Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?" 37. "Who are you, Lord?" 38. "I am Jesus" 39. Ananias's vision 40. Ananias's objection 41. "He is a chosen instrument" 42. Ananias goes to Saul 43. Scales fall from eyes 44. Saul baptized 45. Saul preaches in Damascus 46. Jews plot to kill Saul 47. Saul escapes in basket 48. Saul in Jerusalem 49. Barnabas vouches for Saul 50. Saul preaches in Jerusalem 51. Plot against Saul 52. Saul sent to Tarsus 53. Church has peace 54. Peter heals Aeneas at Lydda 55. Peter raises Tabitha at Joppa 56. Cornelius's vision 57. Cornelius sends for Peter 58. Peter's vision 59. Peter goes to Cornelius 60. Peter's sermon to Gentiles 61. Holy Spirit falls on Gentiles 62. Gentiles baptized 63. Peter explains to Jerusalem church 64. Church at Antioch 65. Agabus prophesies famine 66. Relief sent to Jerusalem 67. Herod kills James 68. Peter imprisoned 69. Church prays 70. Angel frees Peter 71. Peter at Mary's house 72. Herod's death 73. Barnabas and Saul sent out 74. Cyprus 75. Sergius Paulus 76. Elymas blinded 77. Pisidian Antioch 78. Paul's sermon in synagogue 79. Gentiles glad 80. Jews stir persecution 81. Iconium 82. Lystra: healing of lame man 83. "The gods have come down" 84. Paul stoned, left for dead, rises 85. Derbe 86. Return through churches 87. Elders appointed 88. Report to Antioch 89. Judaizers arrive 90. Dispute about circumcision 91. Jerusalem council 92. Letter sent 93. Judas and Silas sent 94. Paul and Barnabas separate over Mark 95. Paul takes Silas 96. Timothy joins 97. Timothy circumcised 98. Churches strengthened 99. Spirit forbids Asia 100. Troas 101. Macedonian call 102. Philippi 103. Lydia converted 104. Slave girl with spirit 105. Paul casts out spirit 106. Paul and Silas beaten 107. Paul and Silas imprisoned 108. Midnight: praying and singing 109. Earthquake 110. Jailer's conversion 111. Jailer baptized 112. Paul reveals Roman citizenship 113. Magistrates apologize 114. Thessalonica 115. Jason's house attacked 116. Berea 117. Jews from Thessalonica pursue 118. Paul to Athens 119. Athens: Paul's spirit provoked by idols 120. Areopagus sermon 121. Some mock, some believe 122. Corinth 123. Aquila and Priscilla 124. Paul works as tentmaker 125. Silas and Timothy arrive 126. Paul devoted to preaching 127. Jews oppose 128. "Your blood on your own heads" 129. Titius Justus 130. Crispus believes 131. Lord's vision: "Do not be afraid, I have many in this city" 132. Eighteen months in Corinth 133. Gallio's judgment 134. Sosthenes beaten 135. Paul leaves Corinth 136. Vow at Cenchreae 137. Ephesus briefly 138. Return to Antioch 139. Third journey begins 140. Galatia and Phrygia strengthened 141. Apollos in Ephesus 142. Priscilla and Aquila instruct Apollos 143. Paul returns to Ephesus 144. Disciples of John baptized 145. Paul in synagogue 146. Hall of Tyrannus 147. Two years in Asia 148. Extraordinary miracles 149. Handkerchiefs and aprons 150. Sons of Sceva 151. "Jesus I know, and Paul I recognize" 152. Evil spirit overpowers them 153. Fear falls, name of Jesus magnified 154. Magic books burned 155. Paul's plans 156. Timothy and Erastus sent ahead 157. Riot at Ephesus 158. City in confusion 159. Town clerk quiets crowd 160. Paul departs for Macedonia 161. Encouragement in Macedonia 162. Three months in Greece 163. Plot discovered 164. Return through Macedonia 165. Troas 166. Eutychus falls from window 167. Paul raises Eutychus 168. Miletus 169. Ephesian elders summoned 170. Paul's farewell 171. Weeping, embracing 172. "You will see my face no more" 173. Voyage toward Jerusalem 174. Tyre: disciples urge Paul not to go 175. Caesarea 176. Philip the evangelist 177. Agabus's prophecy 178. "What are you doing, weeping and breaking my heart?" 179. "I am ready to die at Jerusalem" 180. Paul in Jerusalem 181. James and elders 182. Report of ministry to Gentiles 183. Advice about the vow 184. Paul in Temple 185. Jews from Asia see him 186. Mob seizes Paul 187. Tribune arrests Paul 188. Paul carried up steps 189. "May I speak to you?" 190. Permission granted 191. Paul's defense 192. Crowd's fury at "Gentiles" 193. Tribune orders examination by flogging 194. Paul: "Is it lawful to flog a Roman citizen?" 195. Tribune afraid 196. Before Sanhedrin 197. Paul struck 198. "God will strike you, whitewashed wall" 199. Pharisees and Sadducees divided 200. "I am on trial concerning the resurrection" 201. Dissension 202. Tribune rescues Paul 203. Lord's appearance: "Take courage" 204. Conspiracy: forty men vow not to eat until Paul killed 205. Paul's nephew discovers plot 206. Tribune sends Paul to Felix 207. Letter to Felix 208. Paul before Felix 209. Tertullus accuses 210. Paul's defense 211. Felix delays 212. Felix and Drusilla hear Paul 213. Felix trembles 214. Two years 215. Festus succeeds Felix 216. Jews request transfer to Jerusalem 217. Festus refuses 218. Paul before Festus 219. "I appeal to Caesar" 220. Agrippa and Bernice arrive 221. Festus consults Agrippa 222. Paul before Agrippa 223. "I was not disobedient to the heavenly vision" 224. Festus: "You are out of your mind" 225. "I am not out of my mind, most excellent Festus" 226. "King Agrippa, do you believe the prophets?" 227. "In a short time would you persuade me to be a Christian?" 228. "I would to God that all who hear me might become as I am—except for these chains" 229. "This man could have been set free if he had not appealed to Caesar" 230. Voyage to Rome begins 231. Centurion Julius 232. Sidon 233. Sailing past Cyprus 234. Myra 235. Alexandrian ship 236. Slow progress 237. Fair Havens 238. Paul's warning 239. Centurion overrules 240. South wind 241. Northeaster strikes 242. Ship driven 243. Cargo thrown overboard 244. Neither sun nor stars 245. All hope abandoned 246. Paul's vision 247. Fourteenth night 248. Approach to land 249. Sailors' attempted escape 250. Paul: "Unless these men stay in the ship, you cannot be saved" 251. Paul's encouragement to eat 252. Bread broken, thanks given 253. 276 persons 254. Grain thrown overboard 255. Bay sighted 256. Ship runs aground 257. Soldiers' plan to kill prisoners 258. Centurion prevents 259. All escape to land 260. Malta 261. Viper on Paul's hand 262. Natives expect him to die 263. Paul unharmed 264. Publius's father healed 265. Other healings 266. Three months 267. Departure 268. Syracuse, Rhegium, Puteoli 269. Brothers in Puteoli 270. Rome 271. Brothers come to meet Paul 272. Paul takes courage 273. Paul under guard 274. Paul calls Jewish leaders 275. "It is because of the hope of Israel that I am wearing this chain" 276. Jews want to hear more 277. Appointed day 278. Paul's testimony about the kingdom 279. Some convinced, some not 280. Isaiah's prophecy: hearing but not understanding 281. "This salvation of God has been sent to the Gentiles" 282. Two whole years 283. Paul's own rented quarters 284. Welcoming all who came 285. Proclaiming the kingdom 286. Teaching about the Lord Jesus Christ 287. With all boldness 288. Unhindered PART TWENTY-FOUR: THE LETTERS 1. Jude: keep yourselves in the love of God 296. Jude: to Him who is able to keep you from stumbling PART TWENTY-FIVE: THE TRIAL 1. Jesus led to Annas 2. Annas questions Jesus 3. "I have spoken openly to the world" 4. Officer strikes Jesus 5. "If what I said is wrong, bear witness; if right, why do you strike me?" 6. Jesus sent to Caiaphas 7. Peter follows at a distance 8. Peter in the courtyard 9. First denial 10. Peter warms himself at the fire 11. Second denial 12. Third denial 13. Rooster crows 14. Jesus turns and looks at Peter 15. Peter goes out and weeps bitterly 16. Council assembles 17. False witnesses sought 18. Witnesses do not agree 19. "We heard Him say, 'I will destroy this temple'" 20. High priest stands 21. "Have you no answer?" 22. Jesus silent 23. "I adjure you by the living God: are you the Christ?" 24. "You have said so. And you will see the Son of Man seated at the right hand of Power and coming on the clouds" 25. High priest tears robes 26. "He has uttered blasphemy" 27. "He deserves death" 28. They spit in His face 29. They strike Him 30. They slap Him 31. "Prophesy to us, Christ! Who struck you?" 32. Morning comes 33. Council delivers Jesus to Pilate 34. Judas's remorse 35. "I have sinned by betraying innocent blood" 36. "What is that to us?" 37. Thirty pieces thrown in Temple 38. Judas hangs himself 39. Potter's field purchased 40. Jesus before Pilate 41. "Are you the King of the Jews?" 42. "You have said so" 43. Chief priests accuse 44. Jesus makes no answer 45. Pilate marvels 46. Jesus sent to Herod 47. Herod glad 48. Jesus questioned at length 49. Jesus answers nothing
